thread.title: You can now use fonts inspired by 10 Philly neighborhoods
thread.title_full: You can now use fonts inspired by 10 Philly neighborhoods

author: Emily Babay
title: You can now use fonts inspired by 10 Philly neighborhoods
text:
You can now use fonts inspired by 10 Philly neighborhoods Updated: February 14, 2017 — 7:12 PM EST 455 Share 
Emily Babay is a breaking news producer. She writes about everything from crime to transit problems — and occasionally about good news. 
, based in Philadelphia and Easton, says the neighborhood-themed typefaces are being released in conjunction with the launch of the company's new custom font design services . The company put together the neighborhood fonts to refine its design process before introducing the custom-font part of the business. 
phillyfonts.com . 
: "Inspired by the beer labels used in the neighborhood's brewery heyday." 
: "Based on the neighborhood's gridlike layout and severe angles on its high-rise buildings." 
: Inspired by Eastern State Penitentiary's architecture. 
: Meant to emulate the neighborhood's "edgy, hip personality." 
: Inspired by the "regal and stately English Gothic architecture" of the wealthy area's houses. 
: Inspired by the Manayunk Bridge and "the quirky nature of Main Street." 
: Inspired by "the rough and blighted neighborhoods" in some parts of North Philly. The firm notes that other parts of North Philly have "improved in recent years" and that it is also home to Temple University. 
: Based on the neighborhood's combination of rich history and new restaurants, bars, and galleries. 
: Inspired by the "elegant architecture" Rittenhouse Square and the surrounding neighborhood. 
: Inspired by "the amazing graffiti artwork that can be found in the area."
